text: - Lonely Planet is one
of the world's premier travel publishers
and online travel presence.

Our end user use case for
GenAI was really focused around
how we can answer our customers' call
for more itineraries and experiences

than what we offer in our
current publishing product.
So we were looking at how can we scale
a product that our customers love so much?
And that's where GenAI came in.

We chose Bedrock and the
tools associated with AWS
because we wanted optionality with regard
to what models we were able to use,

and we also wanted security,
resiliency, and compliance.
We leveraged Amazon Bedrock

alongside Anthropic's
Claude-2 large language model

to implement a retrieval
augmented generation solution

that was able to take content
from our beloved book product

and regenerate new
experiences and itineraries

based off of real people
and lived experiences.
I should note that everything
that we put into our experiences

and our itineraries
leveraging generative AI

comes from real people
and real recommendations.
So at Lonely Planet, we use Amazon Bedrock

to really implement three
steps of our itinerary
and experience generation process.
Step one is around extracting

the points of interest
that our editors cover.
Step two is leveraging Claude V2 to bring
that set of points of interest together

into an experience that
is unique to Lonely Planet

based off of our content that
our experts have covered.

And, finally, step three
brings it all together
in a geospatially possible scenario,
which we refer to as an itinerary

for one, two, or more
days for our customers.
We tested multiple models,

and what we found was
Amazon's Bedrock product

was 78% more cost-effective
for our use case
than other popular models in play today.

The adoption of GenAI
has helped us develop
thousands of experiences and itineraries
for 80% less cost than it would

if we were to have our
writers manually curate those.
Furthermore, our writers are now freed up

to go focus on finding the
next in-destination thing

and continue to inspire
travelers everywhere.

Our customers have asked
us over and over again,

more experiences, more itineraries,
more travel inspiration.

And so we're so excited
to be able to use GenAI

and Amazon Bedrock to
deploy unlimited numbers

of experiences and
itineraries for our customers
to spark the joy of travel.
(upbeat music)
